metadata.title: CVE-2021-28677 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in Pillow before 8.2.0. For EPS data, the readline implementation used in EPSImageFile has to deal with any combination of \r and \n as line endings. It used an accidentally quadratic method of accumulating lines while looking for a line ending. A malicious EPS file could use this to perform a DoS of Pillow in the open phase, before an image was accepted for opening.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-28677` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python3-pil - 8.1.2+dfsg-0.1ubuntu1
python3-pil.imagetk - 8.1.2+dfsg-0.1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pillow package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.1.2+dfsg-0.1ubuntu1').
